ARABIC: أَوَكُلَّمَا عَٰهَدُوا۟ عَهْدًا نَّبَذَهُۥ فَرِيقٌ مِّنْهُم بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يُؤْمِنُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: Why is it that, whenever they make a contract, a group of them disdainfully tosses it aside? No indeed!
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And every time they made a pledge some of them pushed it aside, and many of them do not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: Has it not always been so that every time they made a covenant, some of them set it aside? Nay, most of them never believe in it sincerely.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Why is it that every time they (the Jews) make a covenant, some of them abandon it. Most of them do not even believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And is it that whenever they make a covenant, only a group of them throws it aside? In fact, most of them do not have faith.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Is it not (the case) that every time they make a covenant, some party among them throw it aside Nay! (the truth is:) most of them believe not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: What! whenever they make a covenant, a party of them cast it aside? Nay, most of them do not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Why, whensoever they have made a covenant, does a party of them reject it? Nay, but the most of them are unbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Is it ever so that when they make a covenant a party of them set it aside? The truth is, most of them believe not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Why is it that, whenever they make a covenant, some of them cast it aside? Most of them do not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Is it that whenever they enter into a covenant some party among them cast it aside? Aye! most of them even believe not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Is it not that whenever they made a covenant, a part of them would cast it away? Rather, the majority of them do not have faith.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Is it not (the case) that every time they make a covenant, some party among them throw it aside?- Nay, Most of them are faithless.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Is it not (the case) that every time they make a covenant, some party among them throw it aside? Nay! the truth is most of them believe not.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Why, whenever they make a promise do some of them cast it aside! Most of them do not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: Is it not that whenever they make a covenant, some of them toss it aside? In fact, most of them do not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Is it not [true] that every time they took a covenant a party of them threw it away? But, [in fact], most of them do not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [2:100] Why, whenever they make a covenant, with God that they will believe in the Prophet (s) when he appears, or that they will not give assistance to the idolaters against the Prophet (s), does a party of them reject it?, cast it away repudiating it (this is the response to the clause beginning with kullamā, the interrogative of rebuke). Nay (bal indicates a transition), but most of them are disbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Is it ever so that when they make a covenant) i.e. the Jewish leaders with Muhammad (a party of them set it aside?) reject and break it. (The truth is, most of them) all of them in fact (believe not).
